intro: Ledebouria hyderabadensis, commonly known as the Hyderabad bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous structure and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
